Congratulations to some of NCR’s finest musicians— Nick Vallary, saxophone; Michael Drago, trumpet; Evelyn Paul, trumpet; Wyatt Shattes, trumpet; Carrie Davis, low brass; Noah Samonas, low brass—who have earned a spot in the Suffolk County Music Educators’ Association All County Jazz Ensemble on November 2. The SCMEA All County Jazz Ensemble presents an opportunity for musically inclined students across Long Island to merge together to advance and hone their musical abilities. Way to go! #PantherPride

MPSD Honors Lives Lost on September 11th

In honor and remembrance of the lives lost 18 years ago, several teachers at NCRMS took the initiative to educate students and encourage dialogue about the horrific attacks that occurred on September 11, 2001. In Mrs. Saulle’s 7th grade English classes, students listened to and discussed recorded interviews from the 9/11 Memorial Museum’s oral history collection. Mrs. Hibbard’s 6th grade classes learned the significance of artifacts and how they provide insight to our past. Mrs. Luchsinger’s 6th grade classes wrote friendly letters to heroes, read poems that express their thoughts and drew pictures that showcased patriotism. Ms. Suppa’s 7th grade students read and analyzed the lyrics to Alan Jackson’s “Where Were you When the World Stopped Turning?” #NeverForget #PantherPride

New School Year, New Opportunities

We recently welcomed our students and staff back for the first day of the 2019-2020 school year! Across the District, students filed into their new classrooms to meet their new teachers and friends and prepare for a year full of new opportunities and excitement.

Each year, our administrators, educators and Board of Education set high standards of excellence and each year, those standards are met and exceeded. It’s a testament to the commitment, skill and intelligence of all Miller Place students and staff. Welcome back! #PantherPride #EducationalExcellence
